snippet: The migrants poured into Austria on Saturday after being bounced around the Balkans, as Hungary grudgingly allowed at least 11,000 to enter from Croatia.
abstract: Migrants flood Austria, with rate hitting 10,000 in a single day, after being bounced around other European countries that remain unwilling to shelter them; situation highlights infighting among European Union member states as they fail to come to consensus on plan for influx.

byline.original: By SEWELL CHAN and PALKO KARASZ
byline.contributor: Sewell Chan reported from London, and Palko Karasz from Szentgotthard, Hungary. Reporting was contributed by Helene Bienvenu from Beremend, Hungary; Matthew Brunwasser from Sid, Serbia; Barbara Surk from Rigonce, Slovenia; Boryana Dzhambazova from Sofia, Bulgaria; Kristina Bozic from Ljubljana, Slovenia; Melissa Eddy from Berlin; and Bostjan Videmsek from Spielfeld, Austria.

lead_paragraph: The migrants poured into Austria on Saturday after being bounced around the Balkans, as Hungary grudgingly allowed at least 11,000 to enter from Croatia.

headline.main: Thousands of Migrants Flood Into Austria
headline.print_headline: Thousands Flood Into Austria as Migrants Are Bounced Around Europe

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
